job_title: Direct Service Professional in Columbus, IN
pros: I enjoyed the staff and clients that I worked with. The job was very rewarding and allowed me to grow my personal and professional skills.
cons: My weekly schedule was not always consistent, I would not know whether I would be working first, second, or third shift until a few days before or the day of.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: You get to spend a lot of time with clients and improving their well being. Many of the activities are fun and simple.
cons: Some medical and physical services may be gross or in rare cases violent.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Bloomington, IN
pros: Flexibility in hours and times
cons: Poor management and training for all staff

review_title: Wanna be burnt out all the time?
job_title: QIDP in Bloomington, IN
pros: Unfortunately there are no Pros
cons: The Directors, Upper Management, No Flexibility, Working 24/7, No Work-Life Balance

review_title: Don't Work Here If You Have a Life or Responsibilities
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: Working the overnight shift allowed me to have a second job during the day. I never slept, but I needed money so it worked out kinda.
cons:
Basically everything else. 

As a DSP you receive absolutely no support. There is never anyone to help if you need it. You're just told to figure it out or wait around until someone can come help you. Several times my midnight to 8am shift turned into a midnight to noon shift because no one would come relieve me. Which was obviously problematic as I had a second job that started at 1030am. On 7 separate occasions I was told I would have to stay late simply because my replacement DSP had children and an 8am start time was "too early" for them to manage. I also had only one day off a week (Sundays) and there was not a single Sunday in my last 6 months of employment there that I was not called and asked to come in to work because "I had no other responsibilities at home." It was a terrible job for a company who are doing important, essential work. Their first priority are the clients (as it should be) but they are brutally unhelpful with their staff.

job_title: Manufacturing Technician in Bloomington, IN
pros: Nothing but the clients.. they are why I am there
cons: Management, pay, they want you to stay over for meetings

job_title: Direct Support Care Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: It is surprisingly relaxing and a lot of the work you do is just working and hanging out with clients. Going fun places like the park, the movies, etc. and just helping the clients live fun and engaging lives. Also you get TONS of Paid Time Off from working extra hours; 1 overtime hour = 1 PTO hour.
cons: There are health related and medical related components that staff will have to attend to depending on the clients needs, which are not always pleasant. Further, understaffing may be a possibility at a work site HOWEVER it is never required that an employee works more.

review_title: Really excellent company. High stress high reward.
job_title: Skills Development Clinician in Bloomington, IN
pros: Flexibility in full-time scheduling, meaningful work, weekly pay, extensive training. Management that is truly supportive and offers continuous constructive feedback. Position allows for a lot of autonomy and allows clinician to creatively utilize resources in and around the community. Travel mileage reimbursed. Clients are wonderful people. The agency has consistently prioritized the safety of clients and employees in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.
cons: Sometimes very high stress situations. Can be difficult to find good work/life balance due to nature of altruistic work and scheduling based on clients' needs. High turnover rates / chronic understaffing in certain departments can trickle down to stressful situations for clients and other employees.

job_title: Behavior Therapist in Bloomington, IN
pros: Rewarding work everyday, it is a meaningful job.
cons: Management is not good. The company is geared toward people with children.

job_title: Skills Development Specialist in Bloomington, IN
pros: I feel the company really cared about me. My position was very flexible and I had an amazing boss. There are many more positives.
cons: The job can sometimes be stressful and I think the company could do a better job providing resources to use with the clients.

review_title: Fulfilling job but needs to be backed up by pay.
job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Bloomington, IN
pros: Fulfilling. It is a great reward to support those with disabilities out in the community.
cons: The pay does not compensate for all of the hard work that goes into caring for people with disabilities.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Bloomington, IN
pros: Clients, coworkers, day program, overtime, easy
cons: Communication, too many bosses to go through

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: Rewarding job with excellent people to work with
cons: Can be exhausting and draining if self care isn’t done regularly.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: Directly help clients, tons of free time, lots of discretion. A perfect job for a college student looking to study on the job.
cons: Some of the administration requirements were arbitrary. Also, because of being short-staffed, there was little repercussions for bad employees.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Bloomington, IN
pros: There aren't any Pros to this job.
cons:
Constant threat of physical harm.
Zero regard for employee safety, or well being.
Low pay for high-stress job.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: rewarding to work with the clients, easy to pick up shifts
cons: bad day, constantly understaffed, hard to get days off

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: The staffs were friendly also knowing that you are able to touch someone's life was a great deal.
cons: The pay was not that great

job_title: Direct Support Specialist in Bloomington, IN
pros: It's a job, and if you are a sub, you are only required to work a specific amount, making your schedule up to you other than those few required weekends/hours. The clients you work with are amazing. We get quarterly bonuses, it is calculated by the number of hours you work, normally small, but you don't get it if you are a sub or float. Part time or full time (having a set schedule) you can tell them what you can work and they do their best to work with you on it.
cons: If you have an emergency and have to call in (Only called in 3 times in 4 years for legit reasons) they tell you that you have to find your replacement, which is their job. Low pay for what you are doing. Management just depends, some managers are fine, some are completely lazy. There is only a little bit of room to grow with this company and even higher u jobs are not paid very much, unless you get to the big boys. Health benefits are okay, but you can only apply during open enrollment.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros:
There are lots of good people at the ground level who really care about doing their jobs well.

Rewarding work.
cons:
Direct Support Professionals are treated by management as unintelligent and replaceable.

Direct care is a stressful job that not everyone is cut out for.

Low wages.

Also, paperwork.

job_title: DSP in Columbus, IN
pros: Really enjoy making a difference in someone's life,  can burn out easily emotionaly an physically from having to assist the same clients with high behaviors so much that you dread going to work..
cons: Stuck doing same duties with same clients each and every week in rooms with no windows,  bad odors because clients with bad hygiene are not showered before coming into program!!

review_title: A great mission, but too many punitive actions!
job_title: Food Management and Purchasing Specialist in Bloomington, IN
pros: LOVED working with the developmental disability community. I personally liked most of my peers and supervisors.
cons: I felt that management was too much in the mindset of "punishing" staff. We were taught to "make a teachable moment" when working with consumers, but every staff mistake was met with a punitive action.

review_title: Stonebelt is a great place to work. The job is very rewarding and supplies a much needed service.
job_title: Site Supervisor in Bedford, IN
pros: Flexible work schedule, competitive wages, advancement possibilities, surrounded by caring and loving people, and the ability to make a difference in people's lives.
cons: Potential for stressful situations, high accountability and responsibility typically required, team dependency, week long orientation, certain situations may become very frustrating.

job_title: Behavior Specialist in Bloomington, IN
pros: Stone Belt does a fantastic job caring for its consumers -- the individuals that you'll work with are spectacular and there are many, many dedicated employees. It's a terrific organization, and the clinical team is second to none.
cons: Just like any not-for-profit, there are budget constraints, and you'll work with amazing folks and people who are there for a paycheck. But compared to most residential providers, Stone Belt has their act together.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: Very rewarding. Great support system. You learn a lot about working with developmental disabilities which you can use for the rest of your life.
cons: We were constantly short of staff which caused extra stress. High turnover. Long weekend shifts. Some situations were hard to handle.

review_title: Tough but rewarding job with good benefits
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros:
- quarterly performance-based retention bonuses
- rewarding if you like the caretaker line of work
- benefits including insurance and vacation
- very flexible scheduling and slots available 24/7
- competitive pay and overnight pay
cons:
- difficult job in that it requires a lot of patience and understanding individual needs of people with intellectual disabilities
- can be stressful
- sometimes organization within the infrastructure can be frustrating

job_title: Direct Support Specialist in Bloomington, IN
pros: Clients are incredible, and coworkers are typically helpful given the environment and its demands. Wrap around services & employee assistance program are nice.
cons: Management is less than professional. Pays significantly less than other area agencies by dollars on the hours. Hours are not flexible.

job_title: Direct Service Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: Stone Belt is a fantastic organization in the Bloomington Community and one that maintains great transparency, development, and opportunities for even entry-level service professionals.
cons: Like all long-term support and service organizations it can be difficult to work with a population with behavioral concerns and disabilities.

review_title: Overall great company, but they can sometimes ask a lot of their DSPs.
job_title: DSP in Bloomington, IN
pros: Will work with your schedule if you're in school. Includes mileage reimbursement, and good comprehensive training.
cons: If a coworker bails when your shift ends, and their's begins you may have to stay longer or even overnight.

job_title: DSP in Bloomington, IN
pros: Good coworkers, rewarding work. Upward mobility.
cons: Management doesn't leave you alone, constant turn over

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bloomington, IN
pros: They are willing to work with you no matter your circumstances.
cons: Management needs to work on their accountability.

job_title: in Bloomington, IN

review_title: Making the best with limited funds
